alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Sevier Valley; Southwest Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 18 at 1:23PM MDT until August 18 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Central Mountains, Sevier Valley, Bryce Canyon Country, Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity, Glen Canyon Recreation Area/Lake Powell, South Central Utah, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Western Canyonlands, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall causing flash flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, recent burn scars, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flash flooding in urban areas is also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An ongoing monsoon surge combined with increasing tropical moisture will bring an increased threat of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Mountains; Sevier Valley; Southwest Utah
